DifficultyOptions.text: Difficulty options allow players to adjust the challenge level of Five Parsecs from Home to suit their preferences. These options can be used to make the game easier for newcomers or more challenging for experienced players.

content.title: Difficulty Settings
content.description: Five main difficulty settings that affect various aspects of the game:

settings.name: Mess Me Up
effects: No adjustments to Contact markers or Encounter number

settings.name: Living Nightmare
effects: At the end of each battle round, if there are less than 3 Contact markers on the table, place 1 new Contact marker at the center of a random battlefield edge

content.title: Strength-adjusted Enemies
content.description: Ensures a minimum number of enemies based on your crew size:
rules: Instead of rolling for the number of enemies, assume the enemy rolled equal to the number of crew you brought to the fight.
Any bonuses (from enemy numbers, difficulty adjustments, etc.) are added to that number.
Example: If your enemy has a +2 Numbers modifier from the enemy tables, and you brought 5 crew, you will face 7 enemies.

content.title: Tougher Economy
content.description: Options to make money and progression tighter:

options.name: Money is Tight
rules: Actions like Find a Patron or Repair Your Kit cost 1 credit
No free Hull Point repair each turn

options.name: Slower Progression
rules: Increased XP costs for ability score improvements
Lower maximum levels for some abilities

content.title: Enhanced Enemy Quality
content.description: Options to increase the threat level of individual enemies:

options.name: Veteran
options.effect: One basic enemy increases their Combat Skill by +1

options.name: Actually Specialized
options.effect: Enemy specialist figures have a minimum Combat Skill of +1 and Toughness 4

options.name: Armored Leaders
options.effect: Lieutenants receive a 5+ Armor Saving Throw

options.name: Better Leadership
effects: Increased chance of facing a Unique Individual

content.title: Time Pressure
content.description: Options to add urgency to battles:

options.name: They are Paying us by the Hour
options.effect: Limited number of rounds to complete objectives

options.name: There's Movement all over the Place
options.effect: Increasing chance of enemy reinforcements each round

options.name: Fickle Scans
options.effect: Notable Sights must be investigated quickly or they disappear

content.title: Starting Conditions
content.description: Options for a more challenging start to the campaign:

content.title: Reduced Lethality
content.description: Options to make the game less fatal:
options: Ability to exempt one character from post-battle injury rolls
Automatic recovery for a single injured character
